column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Communicate with a Private Person
#Text=Is there that person you want to know better ?
#Text=Do you feel like they are n't going to tell you anything ?
#Text=Do you want to be this person 's friend ?
#Text=If you answered yes to any of these questions then keep reading .
#Text=Steps
#Text=This is probably the most important step of all .
#Text=It 's simple too .
#Text=INTRODUCE YOURSELF !
#Text=You ca n't get close to a person or know more about them if they have no idea who you are .
#Text=Try and get that person talking .
#Text=Find something they 're interested in and talk about that .
#Text=Helping this person feel comfortable around you will help them open up and communicate a little more .
#Text=Hang out with this person .
#Text=Spending quality time with he or she will help this person feel like you want to be their friend , which will help them open up even more .
#Text=Continue to try Step 2 and Step 3 until this person feels comfortable around you .
#Text=Once they 're comfortable around you and consider you a friend then you 've opened them up !
#Text=Congratulations !
#Text=If you want to be more than friends with this person , then try How to Get a Guy to Fall for You or How To Get A Girl To Like You
#Text=Tips
#Text=Try and be friendly .
#Text=You ca n't be mean to this person and expect them to like you .
#Text=Treat this new friend of yours like any other friend .
#Text=Do n't try and get to know them to spill their secrets and humiliate them .
#Text=It 's not very fun to be humiliated in front of everyone that you know .
#Text=Do n't expect immediate results
#Text=Do n't give up and be persistent .
#Text=If that person says " I do n't want you around me " then just leave them alone .
#Text=But until they do , try and get to know them better .
#Text=Break them out of the shell they have .
#Text=If the person does n't warm up to you right away , do n't sweat it .
#Text=This is a private person so they may be trying to figure out if you 're friend or foe .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Make sure you are not exceeding the person 's comfort level .
#Text=Be mindful of their posture and expressions , to see if they are becoming nervous .

#Text=In the event that the person has social limitations or trust issues , it is important that they feel like you are a " safe " person to talk to , who would respect their boundaries and not try to pressure them into more conversation than they are comfortable with .
#Text=Some people have psychological disorders which make social interactions difficult for them .
#Text=It 's rare that they will simply announce this to you .
#Text=Be aware of this possibility , ahead of time .
#Text=While the person may simply be shy , they could also just as well be suffering from PTSD or Social Anxiety .
#Text=These conditions do not necessarily mean that they will never allow you to become close to them .
#Text=However , it may be at a different pace than the one you would normally expect .
#Text=Be respectful and do not impose your pace upon them .
#Text=A gentle and slow approach will give a them a greater sense of ease , and they will be more likely to open up to you .
